bibl.title: Letter from Gustaf E. Lambert to Albert E. Truby, [19--]

div1.p: Lambert thanks Truby for allowing to read his manuscript. He speaks highly of Ames and provides information about Lazear's funeral.

div1.head: Letter from Gustaf E. Lambert to Albert E. Truby, [19--]
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
Dear General Truby
div1.p:
I thank you for permiting me
me to read the manuscript it
brought back a lot of pleasant
memories, also one or two that
so pleasant. Dr Ames was 34 years
old while we were at No1 in - 99
he told me so when he received a
a present from his Brothers The
minister who officiated at Dr
Lezears funeral was Rev McPherson
I was a member of the masonic
Ladge in Habana (Dr Ames helped me
in) and I knew McPherson well as
I were at that time a member of the
Presbyterian Church in Philadelphia
most (of ((or nearly all)) of the cases of
yellow fever that I nursed for Dr.
Ames came in after Dr. Lezear
died. If the General will take the
time to read about the work
I did under Dr Ames I will
gladly write it down and send
it I don't think anyone in
quemados knew Dr Ames the man
better than I did He was my boss
my friend and my protector I have
never come in contact with a man
that I respected and Loved more than
I did Dr Ames to me he was just
wonderful

closer.signed:
Gust E Lambert
4718 Woodlawn ave
Chicago I'll
